text: Michael Morgan (September 17, 1957 â€“ August 20, 2021) was an American conductor. He was music director of the Oakland East Bay Symphony and the Sacramento Philharmonic Orchestra. He was also the artistic director of Festival Opera in Walnut Creek, California. Morgan was born in Washington, D.C. He was openly gay.Anon. (March 15, 2013). "Black gay conductor heads to Atlanta Symphony" . Georgia Voice. Retrieved November 28, 2020. Morgan died on August 20, 2021 at the age of 63.Michael Morgan, Visionary Oakland Symphony Conductor, Dies at Age 63 ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2021 deaths Category:LGBT African-Americans Category:American conductors Category:LGBT musicians Category:Musicians from Washington, D.C. title: Michael Morgan (conductor)
